@ndytg A4 | #ICMIchat

Probably a simple answer to a complex question - but here goes: Show interest in what they learned. Offer them the chance to share their learning with others on the team. Challenge them to set goals based on the training and ask if you can hold them accountable.

@ndytg A3 | #ICMIchat

If the most important thing is listening (see A2), the second is responding to their concerns. Communication during tough-times quiets fears and lets your team know you understand. It has been a tough year. Ask them often, "how are we doing?"

@ndytg A2 | #ICMIchat

Listening must come first in a successful organizational culture. As leaders, unless we know where we are, how will we know where we are going. Employee surveys, walking the floor (MBWA - management by walking around), personal conversations.

@ndytg A2b | #ICMIchat 
I have worked for leaders who I would follow-up the hill into battle - and I have worked for leaders I would charge in-front-of up the hill. I want my teams to see me as the second option! #RelationshipsMatter

@ndytg A2 | #ICMIchat 
I learned from a wise man early in my career - people must come first. He told me to strive to be the kind of leader that people WANT to follow vs. one they follow because of title or position. #RelationshipsMatter

@ndytg #ICMIchat | Icebreaker

I have learned building relationships with other leaders - and the ability to engage and learn from others - is perhaps the best thing about ICMI. I have been here since the beginning - and still see the value every time!
